intro: Busseuillia novae-hollandiae, commonly known as the New Holland bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive cylindrical flower spikes that resemble bottle brushes. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and have a fragrant aroma, while the flowers are usually red or pink in color. Busseuillia novae-hollandiae thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and woodlands.
